content:
Diagnosis:
WHO Grade I meningioma, right frontal convexity
Diagnosed March 2023 following seizure
Subtotal resection April 2023

Previous medical history:
Migraine
Hypertension

Current medications:
Levetiracetam 500mg twice daily
Propranolol 80mg daily

Current situation:
Routine surveillance MRI brain 15 March 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] in the neuro-oncology surveillance clinic today. She remains seizure-free on current anti-epileptic medication and reports no new neurological symptoms. Her last headache was 2 months ago, well controlled with usual migraine medication. Performance status remains 0.

Surveillance MRI brain shows stable appearances of the residual right frontal convexity meningioma measuring 1.8 x 1.2cm, unchanged from previous imaging. There is no evidence of disease progression.

The plan is to continue current management with annual MRI surveillance. I have arranged follow up in 12 months with repeat MRI brain one month before. She understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows stable residual right frontal convexity meningioma measuring 1.8 x 1.2cm

patient_facts.value: MRI brain 15/03/24 shows stable appearances of residual meningioma

status_updates.value: WHO Grade I right frontal convexity meningioma status post subtotal resection. Stable disease on surveillance imaging with good symptom control
Stable appearances of residual meningioma on MRI
Follow up in neuro-oncology clinic in 12 months with MRI one month before
